title: How to earn money while studying in college - Quora

response.answer_text: When I was a college student, the first thing I did to make money, was blogging! Yes, I started a blog and it became 100% successful and brought me $100,000k a month! Just kidding! The blog was a complete failure and I lost my money, time, and energy. But, that was 10 years ago. I am not a college student anymore. College students often work at fast food restaurants and that is completely fine. In fact, I did the same. But the biggest mistake I made was not blogging for 3 years between 2012 and 2015! Now, how can a college student start a blog on the side of a part-time job and studies? Blogging is not something that you can start today and get paid in an hour or tomorrow. I’m writing a step by step guide to starting a niche website. You want to check that first. There is no guarantee that it will ever be going to successful! But, if the contents are great, you’re most likely going to succeed. I have seen many bloggers try to blog for affiliate commissions but to be honest, you are not building a helpful resource here.  How can a college student start a blog? The purpose of blogging should be sharing ideas and experience with others. When I started my architecture blog back in 2008, I wanted to share the modern architectural designs and ideas with other people. As a college student, you can pick your own niche such as the things you are passionate about or something you are interested in. Many college students are interested in photography, videography, filming, cars, etc. You can start a blog about that. Or if you think you have passed the hardest class in your life and you are willing to help others to pass, you can start a blog about that. Now, you are thinking. Umm, where do I start? Where do I write my contents? Well, I think you need to take a step back and think about the search engine. If you want your blog to be noticed by the people, you need to select a niche market. Step 1: Niche market research A niche market allows you to narrow your focus and solve a specific problem! Since you are blogging on the side, it would be great if you could pick a very very small niche and start writing. The example would be, Broad Niche – Auto Microniche – Off-road Vehicles So you can start writing about off-road vehicles. Btw, I just did some research and found this microniche is not that competitive but you need to come up with some unique content ideas. Step 2: Content idea generation I was passionate about so many things but I can write about all of them. I’m passionate about road biking. But when I started writing, I was able to write one single article in 3 days! Make sure you are able to write at least 30-40 unique content about the niche that you pick. The best way to understand the niche is to, start writing an article and see if you are getting writer’s block. The Writer’s block is very common at first. But if you are getting the block in every line, then it’s a matter to worry about. Step 3: Saving money to start the blog This step is missing in every blog posts that I see. People say it’s only $2.95 or $3.95 a month for hosting. Yes, It is. But you need to pay the whole year in advance. Hosting:Currently, Bluehost is offering $3.95 a month if you purchase that 3 years or 36 months. If you purchase the hosting with any hosting companies, you need to pay for the full year at least. So, consider $3.95X36 = $142.20 You can buy it for a year but it will be $5.95 a month then. I recommend you purchase for 3 years if you are serious about blogging. Domain: you will get a FREE domain with Bluehost but you need to renew that domain the next year. Most of the http://dot.com domains are $11.99. So, blogging is not free! You should save at least $150-$200 to get it started! But you can start writing using the advantage of free platforms like Medium and Quora. I will write content pretty soon about how to start blogging on WordPress. Benefits of starting a blog in college There are several benefits that I have missed in my college days. But, I don’t want anyone else to miss. Here are the benefits of blogging in college. Resource building You are building a resource on the side of your studies. This resource can be used by you or other people and it will help others to get things done. Income stream A blog is a great way to earn active and passive income online. Your blog can help other people and you can build a business around it. Most bloggers love to do affiliate marketing and that’s fine. But in order to make some serious cash, product launching is important. Marketing Even if you don’t know how to market your or other people’s product, you can be able to know how to market yourself by starting a blog. Helping others Your blog can be a go-to guide for your audience. That way you grow audience and fanbase who can trust you. So, do you think you can do it? A blog takes a while to grow. Even if you start in college, you can be able to get the full advantage once you get out of college and wait for your employer to pick up your resume.

Right now I’m a college student too! I’m at UIUC studying computer science. Anyway, I make money re-skinning apps. My first year re-skinning, I made over $15,000 working just 1 hour per week. It really doesn’t take much time and fits perfectly into my busy schedule. I think one of my favorite parts about re-skinning apps is that you don’t even need to know how to code! Re-skinning apps is a simple process. You purchase/create an app template, change the graphics, and then sell the app. It will typically take a person 1 to 3 hours to complete the whole process depending on their experience level. After re-skinning apps for over a year, I’ve found that the typical re-skin will make $100 to $300. However, I’ve had single apps sell for as much as $2,000! Most part-time jobs you can get while in college would take forever to pay you this much! If you’re interested in getting started, I would first recommend checking out Chupamobile. Chupamobile is a website for buying app templates. You can usually get a good template for between $50 and $250. This might seem like a lot of money for a template, but you have to remember that once you buy a template, you can re-skin it as many times as you want! Once you’ve selected your template, you need to re-skin it. I like to keep things simple so I usually only edit stuff like the colors, backgrounds, text, icon, and screenshots. Doing advanced stuff like adding features just takes a lot of time and doesn’t pay off very well. Once you’ve completed re-skinning the template, you’re almost there! Now you just need to sell it. I always sell my apps on Flippa, a website for buying and selling apps and websites. Once you sell your first app, re-skin the same template again and repeat the process until you have enough to buy another template! If you think that re-skinning might be a good option for you, I would check out my YouTube Channel for more in-depth tutorials on re-skinning apps. In addition, you should join my Facebook Group to chat with other re-skinners and beginners so we can all learn together! I’ve tried all the other ways to make money online - FBA, Dropshipping, Affiliate Marketing - and re-skinning apps has by far been my favorite. I would definitely give it a try if I were you! Good luck with money and with school!

This is a question that every student thinks once in college. But many lack the driving force. i.e., why they need to earn money and what are the things that they should do to earn money while in college. Now coming to the question Why Should they try to earn money? Your why should be clear as this will only help you to earn money. You should have a particular reason for which you had considered to earn money. I’m citing some of the common reasons below:- I want to learn new skills that will help me to excel in the long run.I want to earn some pocket money so that I could cover some of my expenses.I have a family issue and I want to earn to support myself and my family.I want to be financially self- dependent.I want to utilize my free time after college.I need money for buying some gifts/fulfill one of my desire.These are some of the reasons. You may have any other reason other than this. So once you have the answer to Why to earn, now the next question comes to light How can they earn money while in college? There are many ways by which money can be earned, both online and offline. I’ll try to cover both the online and offline ways by which a student can try to earn money without hampering their studies. Offline ways to earn money:- Providing Tuition Classes:- One can teach students who are studying in schools. By providing tuition, you’ll help the students and get paid some money. You can form tuition groups also to teach many students at a time.Insurance Agent:- You can join any Insurance company with a good reputation. They will give you every detail about the policy and you can try to sell those policies in your circle. So you can work on your own time after college and also learn sales skills.Assistant to any business:- You can work as an assistant for any business like any groceries, stationery, clothing stores, etc. You can also work as an assistant in any business around your locality for 4–5 hours after college.Event Manager:- Event Management Companies hire college students for different types of work such as decoration, catering, etc. So you can work after your college hours for event management companies, as most of the events take place in the evening.Campus Ambassador:- You have to promote a brand or company which hires you on your college campus. Many brands search for campus ambassadors and your main work will be to coordinate the brand's message to your college peers.Mystery Shopper/Auditor:- Many Companies provide mystery shopping opportunities where you have to go to the pre-assigned store/outlet and notice some pre-mentioned points like the surrounding atmosphere, cleanliness, etc. You have to behave like a normal buyer and do as instructed. After the audit is over, you have to fill the questionnaire, where you have to mention the findings of your audit. Once you submit your information, you’ll receive the reimbursement if you were told to purchase anything and you’ll get some money for doing the audit.Online Ways to earn money:- Website Developer:- If you’re tech-savvy and can develop a website on Wordpress, you can earn money by helping people to make their websites. You can make some handsome money by offering to build your client's website.Graphic Designer:- If you’re good at photoshop or can edit pictures, you can provide graphic designing service you’ll design graphics according to clients' requirements and get money in exchange for your service.Logo Designing:- If you can design professional logos, you can approach startups and small businesses and provide your service to them.Content Writer:- If you’re good at any language and can write compelling content, there are many opportunities for you. You can write content for websites, blogs, news portals, etc. You can charge money per word based on your expertise and experience.Freelancer:- If you’re good at anything, be it website development, content writing, video creation, marketing, etc you can work as a freelancer. Once you get a client and deliver the work effectively, you’ll keep on getting projects.Digital Marketer:- If you have some idea of digital marketing, you can sell your digital marketing skills to businesses. You can approach local businesses and offer them to increase their sales and generate revenue for them digitally. Help them to transform from offline to the online mediums of marketing and they will be happy to pay you once you get the results for them.These are some of the ways by which one can earn while studying. People are more reluctant to pay when you produce results for them. You need to learn new skills and upgrade your skills. There are many other ways like blogging, affiliate marketing, YouTubing, selling online courses, network marketing, etc which I could not mention here. If you want to know more about any of the topics mentioned above, do ask me questions about that. You can also message me for any kind of assistance and to know more about these types of work. I hope you like the options mentioned above. Do let me know your thoughts in the comment section.

It is a fact that college is expensive. You will need savings for other important college fees even with financial aid, loans, grants. On and off the campus, there are still opportunities on how to easily earn a few extra bucks. There are plenty of ways to choose from, whether you want a regular or flexible schedule or space for your study.  It doesn't mean that you are broke just because you're a college student. You will make money as a student in a various number of ways and go far further than traditional part-time jobs such as fast food and pizzas. For most students, finding jobs that suit their schedule may be difficult to find. However, many students have found ways to finance their lives without conventional jobs. It can be challenging for students with so many things to do to pay for college fees, but it should not be difficult to deal with these ideas for earning money while studying. Create a Blog or WebsiteYou have to start a website or blog if you want to earn money online. This is your platform for everything you do online and can become a successful business by yourself. Imagine every time you were taking notes on your computer you were publishing it as evergreen content on the web to help others learn as well? Take notes and create guides that can be published online and earn display advertising revenue. Talk about passive income. It’s pretty easy to start a blog or website these days. This tutorial shows you exactly how to do it step-by-step:  I’ve had a ton of success with creating blogs for income online. It’s been a ton of fun and I wish I would have done it earlier. Go for Pet Sitting or House SittingMost people will pay trustworthy individuals to stay in their houses and keep watch on things when they are on vacation. This may include simple tasks, such as mail or pet care. Many websites post this kind of job and link it to household owners. Website example: https://www.care.com/  Tutorial ServicesA mentor who goes from the same school as their child is one of the requirements of some parents. If you are living with your parents, you can use this to your benefit. You may also apply online, offer tutorial services, and search for interested people. You can also teach your colleagues or juniors and charge them with cash. Make the prices cheaper than experienced teachers to help students learn from you. Be a professor's assistantIf you are qualified to be a teacher's assistant, like you've inspired the professor in one of his or her classes or have a good academic reputation, you can get extra money on campus. Although salary varies for teacher's assistants, it also takes around $13 per hour or a minimum wage. Tasks can include such matters as keeping records of students' grades, paperwork assistance, research, and organizational tasks. Become an InterpreterDo you know any foreign language? If so, a translator can be your job. Translation functions from written to oral communication, and is needed on a variety of platforms. Rent out your unused itemsDo you have things that you no longer need in your basement? It can be something you are using, but not so much. You can find many online services that let you rent almost everything you own. You just have to build your rental shop and post your rental items. People are getting in touch and paying you online. A quick and convenient way to earn money. Selling your old books or notesSelling textbooks and notes will win you some big bucks and help out colleagues who might be seeking a cheaper edition of the book they need. This can also be a good way to earn back some of the money you have spent purchasing them. Whether you have the opportunity to travel a bit for work or prefer to stay on campus, there are far more convenient ways to make extra money in college. Regardless of your interest and schedule, there are lots of choices to earn extra money in college. Don't lose hope and go further to achieve your dreams. Good luck!

My father has never been a big businessman. He would earn enough to sustain the family with mostly the basic needs. My mother used to do household chores and help my dad with his shop. My elder brother lived with my maternal uncles' my sister studied in government institutions all her life.My parents could not do much to my siblings. So they wanted to try their level best to make their life a success; for one last time try to be great parents to their kids a role model to them; and I was their last chance.I got admitted to an, Assembly of God Church (an English medium) school. I was quite a bright student and more than being great in studies understood a lot about the world and how it works, how money matters, how savings work, etc.Even as a school kid I knew it for a fact that making money is important.Back in those days I used to buy stickers I loved to collect them and I observed most of my friends at school were also very fascinated by my collection and would wish even they could have such kind of collection. This marked the foundation of the first business plan Of my life in my head.Selling stickers!Within a week I had collected like 100 rupees (Quite a big sum for a first standard student at least, 15 years in the past).OK! So this was the beginning.The pilot phase of my business was done and was way too successful.I was happier than ever in my life.But soon like every good thing this had to end. I had been very furious at supplying the exceeding demand of stickers in my class and soon most of the people had a huge collection enough to make them feel contented. My business showed a decline. I got worried, but was never disheartened (kind of not the kids' thing I feel, they are always hopeful and cheerful; unlike the oldies). I had to think of the expansion phase of my business.I wanted a new idea; and very soon I got one. I stopped selling stickers to my friends and did not do much for a while waiting for the wave to settle.  Then I launched a new item to my friends a flip book with cute cartoons on it. For next few weeks this was hot in the market, and then again the same fate as before.But by now I had mastered the rules of the game.Since I had a small group of people at hand the quantity of demand will be less. So to keep the group engaged I need to keep switching the articles quite frequently. Next time onwards whatever would go out of demand would be replaced by something new and promising. It kept me going for a while but not for long. My friends were kids as well just like me, with limited pocket money. So soon the consumerism decreased. Soon enough I called my business off, but still it lasted an year long. I tried many similar tricks and hacks to make money from countless things (providing the list will only lengthen my answer so let me not) in later years of school. Fast forward it to clg...I was in first Year pursuing B.Tech from NITK, Surathkal. My friends needed a lot of things like books, drafters, drawing boards, etc. There was a guy who would sell these stuffs in college campus. I observed, this guy would buy old goods from the seniors at extremely low prices and would sell them with a really significant margin. I had it all.. The skills to break into his business.I tried to grab as many such articles/stationery from friends/seniors, pay them a little higher than what the guy paid and sell them at a slightly lesser price than at what the guy sold at. Thus I enjoyed making money even there. Though again it did not go for long but this time I was doing it all for fun (as by now both my siblings have got into work and were earning enough to support the family and me).I repeated this for the next three years in a row and enjoyed it quite a lot. So my suggestion to you my friend is look for opportunities, around. All you need is a careful look at things around and you will get it. People are in need of something or the other for sure. You only need to find out the demand; & if you can not find one then Generate one. There is nothing like a "STANDARD OPERATING PROCEDURE " on making money. Extremely sorry for making it long, could not help!Thanks for reading! :)

Well, this is the perfect time to make some money (for a student) and to learn an important business lessons.1. What's going on? First you need to choose your targets (for example students, because most of them are big consumers). Next you need to do a marketing research or just research to see "what's going on" in your city. What they need? What they want?2. Make a budgetFor example if you have 1000$ you need to choose something which is easy and creative. Something they didn't see everyday.3. Do it!Do not let anybody to tell you "It's a bad idea" or "You are crazy" . Do not listen them. If you think you can do that, do it! If you believe, do it! This is the perfect time to see how the "business system" really works. If you have enterpreneur mind, you will learn very important lessons. I will give you an example , what I did in my 2nd year at the university.I was in Italy and I saw one guy who make baked potatoes on the street. When I saw it and when I smell those baked potatoes I reazlie how good is that idea. I buy one and I saw how he make it. I ask him about the baking machine and I saw how easy is it. He get one big potato, cut it on half and put some stuffs inside (butter, sweet corn, cheese, ham & etc.). It was awesome and guess what? When I get back at home I start looking for a spot near the university. I found it and I start negotiate about it. I find the equipment and I bought it. On the first day I sold over 25 potatoes and the people really like it. They start talking about it and at the next day I sold 45-50! So now I gave you an example what I did. Clear your mind. If you can travel somewhere, do it (that helps me a lot). Get some ideas and don't waste your time. Good luck!

You can do work study. I did that in college and the best part was that I could work around my classes. Your school may post the jobs on their website or you can ask a department if they have any work study jobs available and they can give you the information to apply. If work study isn't what you want to do, you can find an off campus job. I also did that in college. The only problem I had with that was once while I was taking my exam, my manager kept calling me to ask me to cover someone else's shift while she knew my class schedules. It was pretty embarrassing, but there are a lot of companies that will be willing to work with your schedule. If neither of those are something that you are interested in, I would recommend starting your own business. I know someone that started a very successful T-shirt business at my school. There was also one person that started a moving company and made really good money from that since you'll ALWAYS have business since literally everyone in college is moving at some point Lastly, you can work from home. At the company I work for, there are a lot of people that are students. A really great thing about my job is that we can select our own hours and work as much of as little as we want to. We can also select the projects in which we want to work. You can find great work from home jobs at Real Ways to Earn Money Online. That's where I found all of my work from home jobs from. Plus, it'll help build your skills and you can add it to your resume. I wish you the best in finding a way to earn money while in college! Good luck!

Here’s what I did back in college. Like most students and needed money. I discovered that you could buy websites and run them from anywhere. From there, I bought websites for $50 at a time and resold for $300 and did that for a while and increased in the amount I was dealing with to the thousands. This is called website flipping To successfully flip websites you need general skills such as: Market Knowledge Know the common multiples for websitesKnow how to properly value websites so you know when you’re getting a good deal or notThe differences between the marketplaces. Flippa, FE International and BizBuySell are all different marketplaces and you need to understand how each one works.Know the current trends of online businesses and websitesAnalytical To be successful at website flipping you have to be able to find deals and this requires you to analyze all marketplaces frequentlyKnow which websites are a good buy and which ones aren’tKnow the strengths and weaknesses of the site before purchaseDelegation You might be able to run one or two websites by yourself but at some point you will need to hire someoneKnowing which tasks to outsource is very importantThose are the general skills that you MUST learn. We have a free 83-page ebook on how to buy an online business that you may be interested in: Guide to Buying an Internet Business - FE International Once you master those then I would suggest finding tactical skill and becoming an expert. It can be any sort of skill such as SEO to e-commerce conversions to link building. Whatever it is, master it. Here is a bigger list to get you thinking: SEOKeyword researchPPC/Paid advertisingE-commerceSocial mediaEmail marketingConversion rate optimization (CRO)Drop shippingLink buildingOnce you master one of those skills you can than use it to find opportunities in the marketplace. For example, if my skill was keyword research and I found a website that had only scratched the surface in terms of the keywords they were targeting then that site might be a good purchase for me. I know that I could buy that site and grow it using my skill of keyword research. This same thing can be applied using any skill, as long as you master it.

41 Sites That Pay You to Refer Friends (Earn up to $13,000!) It’s actually a reality! It’s known as Paid Referrals. Anyway before we begin! Here my number 1 recommended strategy  FREE BOOK - DotComSecrets, The Underground Playbook For Growing Your Company Online... By only giving this a look you will be amazed Word of mouth has been one of the best and most reliable ways for companies, big and small, to get new customers. Heck, when I used to make my living as a floor installer, 99% of my clients were referred to me by their friends, family, and neighbors who I had done a job for previously. People trust their friends and family more than they trust an ad they see on TV. And that explains why word of mouth has been and still is, the most effective form of advertising. Companies know this! They also know that people who are referred by their friends are more likely to become lifelong customers. All of that, combined with the fact that traditional advertising costs a lot of money, gave birth to the idea of Paid Referral Programs. Paid referral programs, or referral marketing, isn’t exclusive to the world of businesses and consumers – companies also use it to hire new employees. Employees referred by other employees are much more likely to stick around for longer because they feel more obligated. According to the Wharton School of Business, a referral customer has a 16% higher lifetime value than your average customer. This is so effective that even universities use it. For example, Vanderbilt University Medical Center has a nurse referral program where they give $2500 to any employee who successfully refers a registered nurse. What is a Paid Referral Programs? It is exactly what it sounds like – you get paid for bringing in new customers to a company/website. Instead of spending millions of dollars on traditional advertising, some companies rely on their existing customers and user-base to get the word out. And to entice you (the existing customer) to talk about their services and products with your friends and family, they are willing to pay you. How do you get paid Now, the exact amount you get paid depends on a few factors. Same applies to the way you are paid. Some companies will pay you a set amount, once. Some companies will pay you a recurring commission for every month/year the person who you referred stays a customer. Some companies give you a percentage of what your referrals spend. When it comes to actually getting paid, some sites pay by PayPal, some by check, others let you redeems your earning with gift cards and other prizes. Ready to make some referral cash? To make it easier for you to get started, we have gathered a list of companies and websites with paid referral programs, across different industries. Look around at what's in high-demand.  Ideally something in low supply too, but if as long as the demand exceeds the supply by a good amount, you can make some serious money doing it. Basic economics never lies.   My experience in high school:  Taught SAT/AP classes, taught chess classes.  I got paid 35-50/hr for all those jobs.  I held maybe 2-3 at a time.  I started teaching them because I needed money and I scored high enough on my tests to have other kids parents pay me.  All you need to do is get really good at dissecting down the topic into manageable chunks and teaching those chunks to kids.  You really only have to dissect them once and you teach all the kids pretty much the same thing after.  You can tweak it a little depending on the person.  Practice makes perfect and luckily, most people will pay you to practice on their kids.   I could ask for those prices because not too many people had the credentials I had and those that did rarely wanted to teach.  But every parent wants their kids to get higher SAT/AP scores and a lot want their kids to learn to play chess well.  I felt like Apple: I could charge basically any price.  I probably could have charged 75/hr, but the parents would start grumbling and I would actually have to put a lot more effort into teaching than I really want to.Also you can try internet marketing, watch this tutorial and start working. If you ever need money in a pinch, this stuff is like intellectual black gold. -Steven

If some one is following this question then most probably he/she would be an Indian, and if that’s true, you need to know many things before knowing exactly the ways. Parenting or nurturing children in India means :- Giving them an extra comfortable life.Getting the students in the so-called best colleges (Narayana or Chaitanya) irrespective of the interest of their child.Getting them into a college paying lakhs of donation or in management quota just because it ‘proves’ their social status or they assume, it will give their child a bright career.And last but not the least , they prefer their children wasting time in wandering around the city or become extra active in social media than taking up a part time job.So first of all you should be ready to unfollow the trend. Secondly, you should be aware of the benefits of working as part time employee while studying. Not just monetary benefits to meet petty expenses, it is the skills which you will be learning which would be useful for rest of the life. You will be learning unconsciously money management as the money now is your ‘hard earned’ money.You will be very good at time management as you will have fix yourself into the ‘new routine’.You can either learn good behaviour or marketing skills depending on what you take up as the job.You will start respecting low profile employees as now you know they too are well-to-do and everyone’s life is different. So you become more humble.You actually come out of comfort zone and face the real harsh world outside.You will get the exposure as you will now start interacting with many.And most importantly, utilising the time in something productive.If you don’t learn these, you would not be able to lead a happy and satisfied life even if you earn lakhs in coming years. It’s imperative to mention that, the parents in western or developed countries happily allow their children to become partly independent after their high schooling probably only because of the above mentioned reasons and Indians studying abroad take up jobs of delivery boys happily while hesitate to do the same in own country. Now coming to the actual answer. You can work in call centres soon after completing 10+2. They may offer up to 5k per month for working 5hours a day. You just need to have fluent English and a local language and more languages would be a bonus for you. This will further improve your communication skills.If you are good at typing, you can join the jobs of Data Entry which will fetch you 4K for working 4 hours a day. If not you can learn typing, it will hardly take 6–7 hours of practice over a period of 15 days.If you think you are good at marketing or you want to improve your marketing skills, join as a sales man in a company selling real good products like education materials. Though it’s the most difficult job, physically and mentally, trust me, it is something which will teach you biggest lessons of your life, and make you prepared to face the slaps life’s going to give in coming future.If you don’t fit in any of the above or you want to know more ways, I would need to know what you are really good at, feel free to message or comment. Remember one thing, studying in schools/ colleges will make you an ‘educated’ person while life experiences will make you a ‘learned’ person.

Well, earning money isn't a big deal. If you are ready to do odd jobs then I have one for you. This is a simple business plan which you could execute during weekends and earn decent amount of money. The investment required is 200-500 rupees. Step 1: Go to a local wholesale store where you could get water cartons. Buy them worth 500 rupees. You'll get 4-5 of them. Also, try bargain. The money you bargained are the money you earned. Step 2: Go to some crowded place such as a bus bay or railway station. Sell your bottles for the MRP that is usually 20 rupees for a basic 1 litre bottle. So, after completing these two steps lets assume that you were able to sell 3-4 cartons that is basically 30-40 bottles. Also, you are working only for 3-4 hours.  Investment on buying the wholesale bottles: 10*50=500Profits when you sell your bottle at 20 rupees: 20*50=1000Money for other expenses such as travel: 100 rupees So, you can basically earn rupees 300-400 if you are willing to do this kind of a job. I am pretty sure that you wouldn't be able to earn this kind of money if you are working for someone. One benefit of doing this kind of work is that you would be able to understand the basics of business and entrepreneurship assuming that you have never done economics in your school. I hope it helps. At least try it out. I have tried it and trust me I was able to earn 5000 rupees a month with full dedication. Thank you!

Some of the best ways that students can earn money at university are: Freelancing: There are a variety of areas that you can freelance in, depending on your skillset. Some of the best options for students include graphic designing, content writing/creative writing, blogging, marketing, research, and sales. Some of these roles will give you a stipend based on a commission or incentive, while others will pay as per the project requirements. Your role might involve editing videos, creating content, doing part-time research, or carrying out intern duties for different firms and organizations.(India) You can find freelancing opportunities on Linkedin, Internshala, Facebook, Monster, or Indeed.com. You can also try reaching out to different brands and sending them an email to see if they have any freelancing opportunities available.Internships: There are a variety of remote/online internships available for students in all fields. The biggest aggregators of internship employers are on LinkedIn and Internshala.Youtube: If you enjoy watching and creating videos, acting, directing, or any other video production related role - Youtube may be the answer to your queries! There are two main ways that you can get involved on youtube. You can either create your own profile and create videos on topics that you’re interested in, or you can try to join an already existing youtube channel/company as an intern/employee.Part-Time Jobs: A lot of organizations offer jobs on a part-time basis to students. These jobs offer students the flexibility to study alongside their degree.Blogging: This might be the most time-consuming process out of all the options available. If you’re a passionate writer, an avid reader, or even someone who’s passionate about a certain field, you can start a blog and create new content surrounding your interests. Unfortunately, It might take a long time before your blog/articles get traction, so this is not really a get rich quick scheme! On the bright side, you will be able to develop a critical skillset, which will help you in a variety of roles.Hope this helps!

Here's what I do for money as a fulltime college student: -work part time at my university as an office assistant (I can do homework when work is slow). -work as a university-sponsored tutor in my major. -sell crafts/art online through Etsy and Facebook. -during summers, I find a camp counselor job that provides room and board plus a wage. -do mechanical Turk tasks on Amazon (most pay a few cents, but they combine to a pretty decent paycheck at the end of the month). -pet sit, house sit, and babysit for my friends and neighbors. -I do audio transcriptions in my free time for professors/researchers, usually at an hourly rate. Obviously, I don't do all of these at the same time.  Studying is a huge priority for me, and sleep as well.  Combined, I might work 20-30 hours per week, and I usually have control over how much work I accept.  It took me some time to build up my work schedule, so go at your own pace and only do what you can.

First, there are four summers (before each of the four years of college).  In each of those four summers, you should be able to work at least ten weeks for 400 hours.  One should be able to earn $4,000 per summer, minimum.   Then during the Fall and Spring terms (roughly 15 weeks each), one could work ten hours per week.   I was able to work 10 to 12 hours per week, refereeing/umpiring the college's (MIT's) intramural sports.  I was paid Double the prevailing minimum wage.    Therefore, you should be able to make at least $2,250 per term or $4,500 per school year.   Adding that up, it should be "easy" to make $34,000 while in college (2015), during those four years, between a full time summer job, and a flexible hours in-term job.

If someone throws up in the elevator at 3 AM, you have to go deal with it. If someone suddenly can't stand their roommate, you have to go mediate it. But all in all, the job isn't difficult or tedious, the compensation is fantastic, and the administration is generally respectful of your academic responsibilities.
